issue.title: [C++] Timezone-aware kernels should also handle offset strings
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14477](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14477). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Both the [format](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/836ffa5656d5107fd4895ae8d7eb0e20a3df23ba/format/Schema.fbs#L341-L347) and the [C++ library](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/836ffa5656d5107fd4895ae8d7eb0e20a3df23ba/cpp/src/arrow/type.h#L1233-L1237) allow this, but kernels rely on a helper assuming that the timezone field of a timestamp is always a timezone name and not a timezone offset.
